edition.label: Libretto 1856 (courtesy of operalively.com)
edition.description: Les Troyens, Grand-Opéra in Five Acts, libretto in French (1856) by Hector Berlioz, based on Virgil's Aeneid. Plain-text transcription provided by http://operalively.com. TEI XML by Christopher W. Blackwell. This text is in the public domain.

translation.label: Libretto 1856 Gazzola and Greenley, trans.
translation.description: Les Troyens, Grand-Opéra in Five Acts, libretto in French (1856) by Hector Berlioz, based on Virgil's Aeneid. Translation by Luiz Gazzola and Natalie Greenley. Copyright 2012, Opera Lively Press. Provided for use by this project under a Creative Commons 3.0 Attribution, Non-Commercial License.

translation.label: Wycliffe (Lichfield, 1410) - Matthew
translation.description: Mathew - A transcription of the Wycliffe translation of Matthew (1410) in Lichfield Cathedral. Transcription from digital imagery, with semantic markup, based on digital images captured by the Univeristy of Kentucky’s Center for Visualization and Virtual Environments, Brent Seales, Director. The images are copyrighted by the Chapter of Lichfield Cathedral, 2010, and are released under a Creative Commons License. Leah Elder, Christopher Blackwell, Brent Seales edd.

translation.label: The St. Chad Gospels (Lichfield, 8th c.) - Matthew
translation.description: A transcription of the St. Chad Gospel in Lichfield Cathedral. A new transcription from digital imagery, with semantic markup, based on digital images captured by the Univeristy of Kentucky’s Center for Visualization and Virtual Environments, Brent Seales, Director. The images are copyrighted by the Chapter of Lichfield Cathedral, 2010, and are released under a Creative Commons License. Tucker Hannah, Tony Brown, Christopher Blackwell, Brent Seales edd.

edition.label: Based on the edition of M.R. Dilts, “Heraclidis Lembi excerpta politiarum”, Durham: Duke University Press, 1971; Greek, Roman and Byzantine monographs 5. Normalized, hierarchical citation scheme, emendations to text, application of editorial and semantic markup.
1709 ed.
edition.description: A New Voyage to Carolina; Containing the Exact Description and Natural History of That Country: Together with the Present State Thereof. And A Journal of a Thousand Miles, Travel’d Thro’ Several Nations of Indians. Giving a Particular Account of Their Customs, Manners, &c. Based on the 2001 digital transcription of this Public Domain work by the University of North Carolina, with funding from the Institute for Museum and Library Services; Apex Data Services, Inc., Melissa Graham Meeks and Natalia Smith.
